25 Norfolk Street, west side between Hester and Grand Streets, showing P.S. 75 adjoining P.S. 62 known as the Emanuel Lehman Foundation.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.
  July 29, 1929.

Hester Street, east from but not including Norfolk Street, showing a typical scene of daily life.
September 30, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Norfolk Street, west Side, north from Hester Street. Clearance shown at the N.W. corner of Hester Street, was formerly the site of P.S. No. 62.

January 16, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Norfolk Street, north from and including Hester Street, as seen from Seward Park.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a different angle and showing Essex Street, west side, north from but not including Hester, to and including Grand Streets. Public School No. 137 is shown in the background on the N.W. corner of Essex and Grand Streets.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, but at an earlier date, showing Public School No. 75 still standing with Public School No. 62 already razed. Both schools were demolished eventually.

title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Bread.

text:
(1) Orangeade vendor, catering to Jewish public, at Norfolk and Hester Streets.
April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Soda pop and cold drinks for thirsty shoppers, at the outdoor Market, Park Ave., and 113th Street, underneath the N.Y. Central tracks.
July 6, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
